edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler

  • public class WolfScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages interactions with a course catalog or a student's schedule
    Author:
    Nick Board

    • Constructor Detail

      • WolfScheduler

        public WolfScheduler(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs a WolfScheduler object. Initializes the catalog and schedule arrays, sets the default schedule title, and tries to read course records into the catalog
        Parameters:
        fileName - Filename for setting up the catalog
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the specified file isn't found

    • Method Detail

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Retrieves a course from the course catalog
        Parameters:
        name - Name of a course to compare to catalog
        section - Section of a course to compare to catalog
        Returns:
        Returns a course object if found in the catalog

      • addCourse

        public boolean addCourse(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String section)
        adds a course to the schedule if it can be matched to a course in the catalog and isn't a duplicate of one already in the schedule
        Parameters:
        name - name of the course to add
        section - section of the course to add
        Returns:
        false if the course can't be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if that course is already in the schedule

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(java.lang.String eventTitle,
                        java.lang.String eventMeetingDays,
                        int eventStartTime,
                        int eventEndTime,
                        int eventWeeklyRepeat,
                        java.lang.String eventDetails)
        adds event to the schedule as long as it isn't a duplicate
        Parameters:
        eventTitle - title of event to add to the schedule
        eventMeetingDays - days the event to add to the schedule will meet
        eventStartTime - stating time of event to add to the schedule
        eventEndTime - ending time of event to add to the schedule
        eventWeeklyRepeat - number of times the event will repeat
        eventDetails - extra details about the event
        Returns:
        false if event can't be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if event is a duplicate

      • removeActivity

        public boolean removeActivity(int idx)
        Removes a course from a schedule
        Parameters:
        idx - index of activity to remove in the schedule
        Returns:
        true If event can be removed

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets a schedule by initializing and empty ArrayList of activities and sets schedule to that empty ArrayList

        catalogArray The entire course catalog

        Parameters:
